html: Crimes of injustice, typified by the administration of wrongful judgments, weigh heavily with Jehovah against his people. Giving or taking “bribes” or “gifts” (sohad) as personal favors for unjust decisions constitutes a betrayal of oneself and of the innocent victims it creates: “When integrity is lacking, they who shun evil become a prey. Jehovah saw that there was no justice, and it displeased him. When he saw it, he wondered why there was no man, no one who would intervene” (Isaiah 59:15-15); “He expected justice, but there was injustice; [he expected] righteousness, but there was an outcry” (v 7).
